'Clayton M. Christensen' (born April 6, 1952) is the Kim B. Clark Professor of
Business Administration at the Harvard Business School, with a joint appointment
in the Technology & Operations Management and General Management faculty groups.
He is best known for his study of innovation in commercial enterprises. His
first book, [[The Innovator's Dilemma]], .
articulated his theory of disruptive innovation. Christensen is also a co-
founder of Innosight, a management consulting and investment firm specializing
in innovation.
